metadata.title: CVE-2017-9103 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in adns before 1.5.2. pap_mailbox822 does notproperly check st from adns__findlabel_next. Without this, an uninitialisedstack value can be used as the first label length. Depending on thecircumstances, an attacker might be able to trick adns into crashing thecalling program, leaking aspects of the contents of some of its memory,causing it to allocate lots of memory, or perhaps overrunning a buffer.This is only possible with applications which make non-raw queries for SOAor RP records.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9103` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

adns-tools - 1.6.0-2
libadns1 - 1.6.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: adns package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.0-2').
